content.description:
Sit start with hands matched at a large jug/undercling. Move up and left to a diagonal rail, then up to and over the lip.

This can also be done as a sit start with a right hand starting on the low jug and a left hand starting on the diagonal rail, which goes at one grade lower.

(This is not in the guidebooks, but it is a fun line.)
content.location: On the boulder directly across from Spiral Traverse (between Spiral Boulder and Slap Boulder). The problem is on the side facing Spiral Traverse.

content.description:
Way finger intensive but classic.

Up onto the flake and lieback it up then head right and onto the traverse. Easy stuff leads to the blunt arete, round this (last great hold for a while) and into the crux section of fingery holds across, with polished footholds to better holds higher up and essentially a handrail to finish.
content.protection:
Pad and spotter if starting from the bottom and heading up the flake.

Video

vimeo.com/12192169
content.location: Low on the north side, underneath a lieback flake.

content.description: At the crux of Spiral Traverse go down to the lower rail instead of up to the good incut holds. Some side reaches are involved, and you're only about 6 inches max above the ground just before the chockstone head up to the finishing incut holds of Spiral Traverse.
content.protection: Pads and spotters, although can be done solo with a pad at the end moves upwards..
content.location: Starts at the crux of Spiral Traverse.

content.description:
Big fun.

Problematically to the undercling. Good crimp above this enables a small pocket to be reached and commitment...

Casually reach for the huge pocket on the lip, or not as the case may be.
content.location: Just right of the blunt arete of the traverse, beneath an undercling.

content.description: Delicately up the slab just right of center until better holds arrive.
content.location: West of Spiral Traverse there's a slabby boulder, the east face of this.

content.description: Start near the beginning of the Spiral Traverse start. Use a high feet and good hands to begin a short slab section until a cut hold near the top.
content.protection: Pad and a spotter to avoid fall off a boulder you start on.
content.location: At the start of Spiral Traverse.
